TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit PolicyConversionContext extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines a class used to retrieve binding assertions in metadata and to attach implementing binding elements at the appropriate scope.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An implementation of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext> is passed to <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyExportExtension> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyImportExtension> objects to export and import, respectively, custom policy assertions to and from metadata. On export, a collection of policy assertions are retrieved in order to add custom assertions. On import, the assertions are retrieved in order to import specific ones and configure binding elements appropriately.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext.GetBindingAssertions%2A> method returns all policy assertions that are for the binding.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext.GetFaultBindingAssertions%2A> method returns all policy assertions for a specific fault message.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext.GetMessageBindingAssertions%2A> method returns all policy assertions for a specific message.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext.GetOperationBindingAssertions%2A> method returns all policy assertions for a specific operation.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext.BindingElements%2A> property gets the binding elements for the binding being described or configured.
- The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext.Contract%2A> property gets the contract description for which the binding is being described or configured.
## Examples The following code example shows an implementation of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyImportExtension.ImportPolicy%2A> method that writes all policy assertions to the console. The code comments describe how to locate a specific custom policy assertion, create and insert an implementing binding element, and remove the assertion from the collection.
[!code-csharp[S_UEPolicyConversionContext#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uepolicyconversioncontext/cs/program.cs#0)]
The following code example shows how to register <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyImportExtension> implementations using the `<policyImporters>` configuration section.
[!code-xml[S_UEPolicyConversionContext#100](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uepolicyconversioncontext/common/app.config#100)]
The following code example demonstrates how a custom binding element can implement <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyExportExtension> to attach a custom policy assertion to the binding assertions.
[!code-csharp[S_UEPolicyConversionContext#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/s_uepolicyconversioncontext/cs/program.cs#1)]

Gets a collection of binding elements to which custom binding elements that implement policy assertions are added.
Docs.value: A that contains the binding elements for an endpoint.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyAssertionCollection GetBindingAssertions() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of policy assertions from metadata.
Docs.returns: An of type that contains binding policy assertions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The collection returned from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext.GetBindingAssertions%2A> is not a copy. You can add and remove assertions as necessary.
## Examples The following code example shows an implementation of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyImportExtension.ImportPolicy%2A> method that writes all policy assertions to the console. The code comments describe how to locate a specific custom policy assertion, create and insert an implementing binding element, and remove the assertion from the collection.
